cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet a named storm)
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (155 km) NNE of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Florida Keys Monday, then tracking northwestward through the east-central Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast – likely near the Mississippi-Alabama border, east of Plaquemines Parish, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama-Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, LA, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) could reach Plaquemines Parish Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the southeast Louisiana coast, including the lower Mississippi River delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring totals over 4 inches with localized flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents will hamper vessel operations; possible river rises and minor flooding in low-lying port facilities.
